dt.t: no {wi}need{/wi} to apologize
the {wi}need{/wi} to pay taxes

dt: {bc}a lack of something requisite, desirable, or useful

dt.t: a building adequate for the company's {wi}needs{/wi}

dt: {bc}a physiological or psychological requirement for the well-being of an organism

dt.t: health and education {wi}needs{/wi}
The house is in {wi}need{/wi} of repair.
refugees in {wi}need{/wi} of shelter and food
The community program provides for those in {wi}need{/wi}.

et: Middle English {it}ned{/it}, from Old English {it}nīed, nēd{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}nōt{/it} distress, need, Old Prussian {it}nautin{/it} need
shortdef: a lack of something requisite, desirable, or useful
a physiological or psychological requirement for the well-being of an organism

dt.t: you {wi}need{/wi} not answer
she {wi}need{/wi} only wait

shortdef: to be in need of : require

dt: {bc}a very obvious need {bc}a serious and important need

dt.t: There's {it}a crying need{/it} for reform in this city.

shortdef: a very obvious need : a serious and important need

meta.id: a friend in need is a friend indeed
stems: a friend in need is a friend indeed

hwi.hw: a friend in need is a friend indeed

dt: used to say that a friend who will help someone when help is needed is a true friend

shortdef: —used to say that a friend who will help someone when help is needed is a true friend

dt: {bc}when it is necessary to do so

dt.t: Jobs will be created {it}as the need arises{/it}.

shortdef: when it is necessary to do so

dt: {bc}to have a strong feeling that one must have or do something

dt.t: I {it}felt a need{/it} to take control of the situation.
I {it}feel the need{/it} to try again.
drivers who {it}feel the need{/it} for speed

shortdef: to have a strong feeling that one must have or do something

dt: {bc}the time when help is most needed

dt.t: They helped us in our {it}hour of need{/it}.

shortdef: the time when help is most needed

dt.t: You can always call me at home {it}if need be{/it}.
We'll leave without them {it}if need be{/it}.

dt: {bc}in a condition of needing something (such as the things one needs to live)

dt.t: a charity that raises money for women and children {it}in need{/it}

shortdef: in a condition of needing something (such as the things one needs to live)

dt: used to say that someone or something needs to have something

dt.t: The program is {it}in{/it} desperate/dire/urgent {it}need of{/it} financial support.
More important things were {it}in need of{/it} her attention.
The trucks are {it}in{/it} constant {it}need of{/it} repair.

shortdef: —used to say that someone or something needs to have something
